items.title: This 14th century story fooled the world about the Black Death
bullets: • A poem by Ibn al-Wardi in Aleppo in 1348/9 was mistaken for an eyewitness account of the Black Death's rapid spread across Asia
• The poem became the foundation for centuries of misinformation about how the plague spread
• The new study exposes how fiction blurred with history and highlights how creative writing helped medieval societies process catastrophe
